required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Ledipasvir/Sofosbuvir on the Pharmacokinetics and Renal Safety of Tenofovir Alafenamide (TAF)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Ledipasvir/Sofosbuvir Treatment on the Pharmacokinetics and Renal Safety of Tenofovir Alafenamide (TAF) in Patients With HIV.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will evaluate the effect of ledipasvir/sofosbuvir (LDV/SOF) treatment on the pharmacokinetics (PK) and renal safety of tenofovir in the form of tenofovir alafenamide (TAF). Subjects living with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) who are receiving tenofovir-based antiretroviral therapy (in the form of tenofovir disoproxil fumarate [TDF]), and are also taking a ritonavir- or cobicistat-boosted protease inhibitor will be invited to participate.
The study will consist of five visits: a screening visit, three abbreviated 4-hour pharmacokinetic visits, and one end-of-study follow-up visit.
Subjects will also be asked to use a Wisepill device, which will track medication adherence throughout the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Week 12 Plasma Tenofovir Area Under the Plasma Concentration vs. Time Curve From Time 0 to 24 Hours (AUC0-24) at 24 and 28 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Compare plasma tenofovir AUC0-24 between TAF with boosted PI vs. TDF with boosted PI (Phase 2 vs. 1), and between TAF with boosted PI and LDV/SOF vs. TDF with boosted PI (Phase 3 vs. 1)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Week 12 Tenofovir-diphosphate (TFV-DP) in Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cells (PBMCs) at 24 and 28 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Compare tenofovir-diphosphate (TFV-DP) in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) between TAF with a boosted PI vs. TDF with a boosted PI (Phase 2 vs. 1), and TAF with a boosted PI and LDV/SOF vs. TDF with a boosted PI (Phase 3 vs. 1).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Week 12 Tenofovir-diphosphate (TFV-DP) in Dried Blood Spots (DBS)
secondary_outcome.description: Compare tenofovir diphosphate (TFV-DP) in dried blood spots (DBS) between TAF with a boosted PI vs. TDF with a boosted PI (Phase 2 vs. 1), and TAF with a boosted PI and LDV/SOF vs. TDF with a boosted PI (Phase 3 vs. 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) and Renal Biomarkers: eGFR
secondary_outcome.description: Change in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) and Renal Biomarkers: UPCR
secondary_outcome.description: Change in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) and renal biomarkers: Urine protein to creatinine ratio (UPCR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) and Renal Biomarkers: B2M/Cr Ratio, and RBP/Cr Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Change in renal biomarkers: urinary beta-2 microglobulin (B2M)/creatinine (Cr) ratio, and urinary retinol binding protein (RBP)/Cr ratio

arm_group.arm_group_label: TAF with a boosted PI and LDV/SOF
arm_group.description: Participants who are already taking tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (in the form of Viread or Truvada) in combination with either a ritonavir- or cobicistat-boosted protease inhibitor for HIV treatment will continue to take their prescribed treatment for 12 weeks after enrollment. Participants will be switched from tenofovir disoproxil fumarate to tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) 25 mg/emtricitabine (FTC) 200 mg (Descovy) with a boosted protease inhibitor for the next 12 weeks. After taking TAF/FTC for 12 weeks, participants will then start taking ledipasvir 90mg/sofosbuvir 400mg (LDV/SOV, Harvoni) in combination with TAF/FTC and a boosted protease inhibitor for 4 weeks. Participants will then return to taking TAF/FTC with a boosted protease inhibitor for the final 12 weeks of the study.

intervention.intervention_name: TDF with a boosted protease inhibitor
intervention.description: Participants who are already taking tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (in the form of Viread or Truvada) in combination with either a ritonavir- or cobicistat-boosted protease inhibitor for HIV treatment will continue to take their prescribed treatment for 12 weeks after enrollment. Other: Blood draws for tenofovir PK, renal function assessment
intervention.arm_group_label: TAF with a boosted PI and LDV/SOF
intervention.other_name: Viread or Truvada with a boosted protease inhibitor

intervention.intervention_name: TAF with a boosted protease inhibitor
intervention.description: Participants will be switched from tenofovir disoproxil fumarate to tenofovir alafenamide 25 mg/emtricitabine 200 mg with a boosted protease inhibitor. Other: Blood draws for tenofovir PK, renal function assessment
intervention.arm_group_label: TAF with a boosted PI and LDV/SOF
intervention.other_name: Descovy with a boosted protease inhibitor

intervention.intervention_name: TAF with a boosted protease inhibitor and LDV/SOF
intervention.description: After taking tenofovir alafenamide/emtricitabine for 12 weeks, participants will then start taking ledipasvir 90 mg/sofosbuvir 400 mg (Harvoni) in combination with the tenofovir alafenamide 25 mg/emtricitabine 200 mg (Descovy) and a boosted protease inhibitor for 4 weeks. Subjects will then return to taking tenofovir alafenamide 25 mg/emtricitabine 200 mg (Descovy) and a boosted protease inhibitor for the final 12 weeks. Other: Blood draws for tenofovir PK, renal function assessment
intervention.arm_group_label: TAF with a boosted PI and LDV/SOF
intervention.other_name: Descovy with a boosted protease inhibitor and Harvoni

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between 18-70 years of age
- Have been taking TDF and a ritonavir- or cobicistat-boosted protease inhibitor as part of standard care for treatment of HIV
Exclusion Criteria:
- eGFR < 30 mL/min
- Pregnant or planning pregnancy
- Breastfeeding
- Any medical, social, or mental-health issue(s) that, in the opinion of the investigators, could interfere with study participation or the study outcomes
- Signs or symptoms of decompensated liver disease
- Hepatitis B infection
- Medications that may cause unwanted drug interactions with ledipasvir/sofosbuvir or emtricitabine/tenofovir alafenamide
- Unwillingness or inability to comply with study procedures
- Chronic hepatitis C infection

group.title: TAF With a Boosted PI and LDV/SOF
group.description: Subjects who are already taking tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (in the form of Viread or Truvada) in combination with either a ritonavir- or cobicistat-boosted protease inhibitor for HIV treatment will continue to take their prescribed treatment for 12 weeks after enrollment. Subjects will be switched from tenofovir disoproxil fumarate to tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) 25 mg/emtricitabine (FTC) 200 mg (Descovy) with a boosted protease inhibitor for the next 12 weeks. After taking TAF/FTC for 12 weeks, subjects will then start taking ledipasvir 90mg/sofosbuvir 400mg (Harvoni) in combination with TAF/FTC and a boosted protease inhibitor for 4 weeks. Subjects will then return to taking TAF/FTC with a boosted protease inhibitor for the final 12 weeks of the study. TDF with a boosted protease inhibitor: Subjects who are already taking tenofovir disoproxil fumarate 300 mg (in the form of Viread or Truvada) in combination with either a ritonavir- or cobicistat-boosted protease

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
